channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9959] Remove some array copy - server side
item.summary: Remove some array copy - server side

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
lgtm.


+  public Put(ByteBuffer row, long ts) {

+    checkRow(row);

+    this.row = new byte[row.remaining()];

+    row.get(this.row);

+    this.ts = ts;

+    if (ts < 0) {

+      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Timestamp cannot be negative. ts=" + ts);

Consider moving the check of ts up - maybe following checkRow(row).

It clashed with the tags. New version takes into account Ted's comment.

This message is automatically generated.
Patch looks fine. Seems like it is taking up BBs but maybe not a big win in this case?

taking up BBs but maybe not a big win in this case?

It's difficult to say. Obviously, the region server is much more i/o bound than the client so saving copies and allocation could be less interesting. I've fixed these one because they were on the top list when I profiled the objects creation. I think it's useful at then end. As well, with SSD & so on we might expect the object creation to be more & more important, so starting to use ByteBuffer likely a step in the right direction...
